Each click adds 100 to your offer (or lowers your demand by the same amount).
Some resources are lost to corruption: the recipient gets $NUM0% of the resources plus $NUM1% for each #ICON26 Commerce technology you have researched.
You can SHIFT + click to add 500 to your offer, or ALT + click to offer everything you have.
This nation has demanded resources from you (and is offering nothing in return). Click here to meet these demands by sending the resources; they will be transferred immediately from your treasury.
Nations at peace cannot attack one another without declaring war first.
Military units which violate a peace treaty by entering a nation's territory suffer severe attrition damage.
Click to make this proposal to this nation. If the nation accepts, the deal will be completed.
Click to refuse to pay the tribute demanded.
Click to reject the proposal on the table.
You are allied with this nation; click here to break the alliance and change your status to peace.
When two nations are allied, their territories are combined, and they jointly win the game if they fulfill the victory conditions.
Except in a {Team} game, you may not have more than one ally at a time.
You are at peace with this nation; click here to declare war.
Nations at peace cannot attack one another without declaring war first.
Military units which violate a peace treaty by entering a nation's territory suffer severe attrition damage.
A timed peace lasts for 5 minutes; then war resumes!
During a timed peace nations may not attack each other {*4NOR may they declare war}.
Military units which violate a peace treaty by entering a nation's territory suffer severe attrition damage.
Click to demand resources from the other nation.
The player controlling that nation will be informed of your demand and may decide whether or not to accede to it.
Declaring war allows your units and buildings to attack that player's units and buildings.
Unfortunately, the player can (and definitely will) retaliate.

$LEADERNAME0 will receive $NUM1% of that amount.

$LEADERNAME0 will receive $NUM1% of that in #ICON2 Wealth.

Any site which can be captured can also be given to an ally.
You cannot give away your last city.
Giving away a site costs $NUM0 #ICON1 Timonium.
Giving away a City costs $NUM2 #ICON1 Timonium for every district in the City.
You will lose 100 #ICON1 Timonium.
$LEADERNAME0 will receive $NUM1% of that amount.
Add more City Districts to increase the percentage which gets through.
Any unit other than a hero or master unit can be given to an ally.
Giving away a unit costs $NUM0% of the unit's resource value.
You will lose 100 #ICON2 Wealth.
$LEADERNAME0 will receive $NUM1% of that amount.
Add more City Districts to increase the percentage which gets through.

Add more City Districts to increase the percentage which gets through.
When two nations are allied, their territories are combined, and they jointly win the game if they fulfill the victory conditions.
Except in a {Team} game, you may not have more than one ally at a time.
Neutral nations cannot attack each other without first declaring war.
The number of cities this leader controls.
The relationship between these two leaders.
Nations at peace cannot attack one another without declaring war first.

You are at war with this nation and can attack them.
You will not receive treaty requests from muted players.
You will not see any of the chat from muted players.

Click to construct a new building.
Add City Districts directly at the City.
Click to research new advancements.
{A^Add Magus Districts to collect more #ICON3 Research Points.^}
{V^Build Research Labs to collect more #ICON3 Research Points.^}
{C^Add any District to collect more #ICON3 Research Points.^}

{Advanced Options} turns on additional buttons and displays, which are not necessary to play the game but may come in handy for veteran players.
{Help Text Detail} allows you to choose the level of rollover text shown on-screen. Clicking the button toggles the settings between LOW, MEDIUM, and HIGH.
Click to see the objectives and victory conditions for the current game.
Click here to initiate diplomacy with other nations.
Click here to access the Prototype Factory for unusual benefits.
The number on the tab is the number of benefits you may select.
Add Industrial Districts to gain access to more benefits.
Click here to open the Quest Log.
Move to a map location without engaging enemies (or just right-click with units selected).
Target a unit to {*4follow} that unit.
Attack an enemy unit (or just right-click with units selected).
Target a friendly unit to {guard} that unit.
Target a map location for {*4Attack Move}: units engage enemies while moving.
Patrolling units will walk back and forth between their current location and one or more points you specify.
Combat units on patrol will attack any enemies they encounter.
Combat units assigned to Guard will stay close to the friendly unit you specify and attack anything that threatens it.
Units assigned to {Follow} will follow the unit you specify.
Units move forward a short distance, attacking any enemies they encounter.
Useful for advancing in formation.
Automatically seek out and explore unvisited areas of the map.
When not performing another order, units set to {Aggressive} will chase and attack enemies.
When not performing another order, units set to {Defensive} will chase and attack enemies for a moderate distance before returning to the spot where you left them.
When not performing another order, units set to {Sentry} will chase and attack enemies for a very short distance before returning to the spot where you left them.
When not performing another order, units set to {Passive} will completely ignore enemies.
Units set to {Auto Craft} will automatically use their special abilities defensively.
Units set to {Manual Craft} will never use special abilities unless explicitly ordered.
Click here or press ALT + R to open or close this display permanently.
The speed at which your miners are gathering Timonium.
If this turns red, you have exceeded your Resource Cap; add {A^Merchant Districts^}{V^Merchant Districts^}{C^Reactor Districts^}.
The number of miners you have mining / the number of spots available at Timonium deposits in your territory.
Create Caravans at your Cities to increase Wealth income.
Add Merchant Districts to increase your Caravan Limit.
Click here or press ALT + R to open or close this display permanently.
The speed at which Caravans are generating Wealth.
If this turns red, you have exceeded your Resource Cap; add Merchant Districts.
# Caravans you have / # Caravans allowed / # Trade routes available
Add more Merchant Districts to increase the number of Caravans you are allowed.
The number of trade routes available is determined by the number of Cities and sites you have found.
Add Reactor Districts at your Cities to increase #ICON4 Energy income.
The more sites you control the more #ICON4 Energy you get.
Click here or press ALT + R to open or close this display permanently.
The speed at which Reactor Districts are generating Energy.
Reactor Districts also increase your Resource Cap.
Send miners here to gather {Timonium} #ICON1.
The number of heads is the number of Miners allowed here.
Building a {Mine} will enhance the output of miners working here.
When {Flashing Yellow}, you need to increase your #ICON20 Resource Cap by adding more {A^Merchant Districts^}{V^Merchant Districts^}{C^Reactor Districts^}.
Current population / the maximum you can support.
Some units consume more than one point of population.
Add Military Districts or capture Inns to raise this cap.
Shows the maximum rate at which you can collect any resource.
When {Flashing}, you have reached your #ICON20 Resource Cap in one or more resources - you can't collect that resource any faster no matter how many more gatherers or gather buildings you create.
To increase this limit, you must add more {A^Merchant Districts^}{V^Merchant Districts^}{C^Reactor Districts^}.
Shows your population's ability to support caravans.
When {Flashing}, you have reached your #ICON8 Caravan Limit and are currently unable to produce additional caravans.
The more Caravans you have plying trade routes, the more Wealth you will accumulate.
Orders your planes to attack a target or patrol an area.
Orders your planes to a new home base.
Orders your planes to fly to the point you indicate and attack any targets they find.
Selects all of your aircraft.
While on, aircraft returning to base will automatically repeat their missions as soon as they refuel. While off, aircraft returning to base will remain there.
Orders this aircraft to abort its mission and return to base.
Orders all aircraft currently flying from this base to abort their missions and return.
Orders all aircraft into the air immediately. Once launched, aircraft will attack any nearby enemies they see.
Aircraft in this column are {refueling} after a mission.
Aircraft in this column are {ready} and can be given new orders.
Click to cancel construction of this building.
Click to cancel this action.
Click to cancel the current action.
Click to cancel.
Ejects all units garrisoned inside.
Causes the unit to appear outside the building (or unit) it has been ejected from.
Units ejected from a building will attempt to move to the building's rally point, if any.

AWAY.ENTRY: Sets your user to the away mode. Players who message you directly will get this message back. /away with no message clears the setting.

BROADCAST.ENTRY: Send a message from inside the staging room to the lobby channel chat
Ex: /b Hey everyone come join my game!

EMOTE.ENTRY: Sends an action message to the chat.

FRIENDS.ENTRY: Accesses the various friend mangement commands
- list - Lists all known friends (alias l)
- add {name} - Adds a friend to buddy list (alias a)
- msg {message} - Sends a message to all friends (alias m)
/f m Want to play a game?

UNIGNORE.ENTRY: Allow messages to be received from a user

WHISPER.ENTRY: Send private message to a user.
Ex: /w BHG_Masta Want to play a game?

WHO.ENTRY: List users in the current channel.

WHOIS.ENTRY: List player's online/offline status, where they are, and what they are doing.

REJOIN.ENTRY: Resets the user to receive staging room chat only

HELP.ENTRY: Here is a list of the available chat commands.
Type /help {command} to get help with a particular command.

STRING.TEXT: #ICON20 {Resource Cap}
The maximum rate per minute you can gather resources.
Add {C^Reactor Districts^}{A^Merchant Districts^}{V^Merchant Districts^} to raise this cap.

The maximum rate per minute you can gather resources.
[You are at your Resource Cap. Some of the resources you gather are being lost!]
Add {C^Reactor Districts^}{A^Merchant Districts^}{V^Merchant Districts^} to raise this cap.

Left-click to select the units and buildings in this group.
Right-click here with units selected to add them to this group.
Right-click with buildings selected to rally the buildings to this group.
Shift + right-click here to start a patrol order.
/team, /enemies, /all to switch "group" chat.
To chat with a specific player. /playername or /playercolor
$PLAYER0 is storming this building.
When complete, $PLAYER0 will gain control of the building.
This Small City is being upgraded to a full-sized City.

This is a "No Rush" game. Players may not attack one another until this timer expires. Units which enter a non-allied player's territory during this period will suffer severe attrition damage.
This air unit is refueling.
This unit is ready to launch. To launch an attack, right-click a target.
This unit is ready to launch.
You can choose to continuously bombard a map location (as opposed to a specific unit or building).
Click to see the previous screen of building types.
Toggles camera between default and extended positions.
Drag with {Mouse Wheel} to spin/tilt camera; roll wheel to zoom.
Other default camera keys: {Alt + X} for Pan, {Alt + C} for Follow Unit.
Click to center on selected object.
{Chat} allows you to type a message to the other players.
You can also use SHIFT + ENTER to send a message to everyone, CTRL + ENTER to send to your allies, and ALT + ENTER to send to your enemies.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
If chat is on for a nation, your chat messages and signals will be seen by the player(s) controlling it.
If chat is off, no chat messages or signals will go to that nation.
Click to remove the Rally Point for this building. Units created here will appear near the building.
Holy Ark enhances production by +$NUM1/ miner.
The disembark command tells units to get off transport ships at a particular land location.
Drag to create a box that selects multiple units.
Click to place unit; drag to set facing.

Right-click to set initial orders. SHIFT + right-click to add additional waypoints. CTRL + right-click to move unit(s) to new location. While holding down right mouse button, left-click to set formation and roll mouse wheel to set width of formation.

Press SHIFT while dragging a box around units to add them to your current selection. Press CTRL while dragging a box around units to select Civilian as well as Military units. Press ALT to select only air units, or ALT + CTRL to select only ground units.
Grouping can be used to keep track of units on the map.
Or use an empty group to store a camera position.
You can use 0-9 and F1-F8 to create groups.
Grouping can be a useful way to help you keep track of units (or buildings) at different places on the map.
Set a group with nothing selected to save a {camera view} - the camera will return to the saved position and zoom level. Use this to keep track of key points on the map.
Groups can be activated with the number keys (0-9).
You can also set F1-F8 to create groups.
Hold down CTRL + SHIFT to erase a group.
Causes the selected unit to stop whatever it is doing.

Shows a diagram of the entire World Map. You can use the Mini Map instead of the Main Map to select destinations for your units. The type of information provided by the Mini Map can be controlled by changing the Data display$HOTKEYSTRING0.

When Infinite Queue is on, a building will continue to produce units in the order currently specified in its queue for as long as there are resources available to produce them. When a unit is created, nothing is removed from the queue: the queue simply cycles to the next item.
Click to open the game menu.
From the game menu you can save and load games, quit the game, or adjust user options.
By default the {F11} key also provides a shortcut to your user options.
Reviews game and chat messages which have previously appeared.
You can use {CTRL + PAGE UP} and {CTRL + PAGE DOWN} to scroll the message window, and {ESC} to close it.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
Click to see the next screen of building types.
You have captured this town but have not yet {assimilated} it into your nation.
Held cities are assimilated after a period of time.
Until a city is assimilated you cannot construct new Districts in it nor create units there.
Causes a flashing signal to appear on other players' maps.
Any players you've set to receive chat will receive the signal.
Click and {drag} the mouse to draw an arrow.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
Click to see the previous screen of buildings.
Lets you pick a location on the map to which new units created here will move automatically.
You can also rally on a hero, control group, or unit, in which case new units will attempt to join the target wherever it is on the map, and will enter any control group(s) the target is part of.
Clears this building's rally point.
New units created here will appear near the building.
If you set a rally point on the map, all ready aircraft will immediately launch to the rally point.
New aircraft created at this air base will go to the rally point.
Aircraft in flight from this base will divert immediately to the rally point.
Displays a large strategic map of the whole world.
Displays icons you can use to designate and quickly select groups of units.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
Toggles the resource rates display so you can see how quickly you are gathering resources.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
Friend/Foe Colors are an alternate way to color units and buildings.
When active, your units are blue, your allies are cyan, your enemies are red, and players you're at peace with are yellow.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
Determines how much help text is displayed on the screen.
You can also hold down the {*4ALT key} at any time to temporarily display maximum help text.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
Allows you to view player scores, teams, and diplomacy.
In Tournament Mode you will only see scores for your own team.
{*4Right-click} to change the function of this button.
